text: The Skip Prosser Man of the Year Award is an award given annually to the nation's men's head basketball coach in NCAA Division I competition who also exhibits strong moral character. The award was established in 2008 and is named for head coach Skip Prosser, who spent most of his coaching tenure at Xavier and Wake Forest. Prosser is the only coach in NCAA history to lead three separate teams to the NCAA Tournament in his first season with the team. Prosser died from a heart attack on July 26, 2007, at age 56. ==Winners== {| class="wikitable" |- | style="background-color:#FFE6BD" |* |Awarded the Naismith College Coach of the Year the same season |- |Coach (X) |Denotes the number of times the coach has been awarded the Skip Prosser Award |} {|class="wikitable sortable" align="center" !Year !Coach !School !Record !class=unsortable | Reference |-align=center | 2007–08 | | Notre Dame | | |-align=center | 2008–09 | | | | |-align=center | 2009–10 | | Sam Houston State | | |-align=center | 2010–11 | | Xavier | | |-align=center | 2011–12 | | Loyola (MD) | | |-align=center | 2012–13 | | Niagara | | |-align=center | 2013–14 | | Green Bay | | |-align=center | 2014–15 | | Central Michigan | | |-align=center | 2015–16 | | Army | | |-align=center | 2016–17 | | Wake Forest | | |- |-align=center | 2017–18 | Casey Alexander | Lipscomb | | |-align=center | 2018–19 | | Norfolk State | | |-align=center | 2019–20 | | Western Carolina | | |-align=center |} ==Winners by school== {|class="wikitable" align="center" |- !School !Winners !Years |-align="center" |Army |1 |align=left | 2016 |-align="center" |Central Michigan |1 |align=left | 2015 |-align="center" |The Citadel |1 |align=left | 2009 |-align="center" |Green Bay |1 |align=left | 2014 |-align="center" |Lipscomb |1 |align=left | 2018 |-align="center" |Loyola (MD) |1 |align=left | 2012 |-align="center" |Niagara |1 |align=left | 2013 |-align="center" |Norfolk State |1 |align=left | 2019 |-align="center" |Notre Dame |1 |align=left | 2008 |-align="center" |Sam Houston State |1 |align=left | 2010 |-align="center" |Wake Forest |1 |align=left | 2017 |-align="center" |Xavier |1 |align=left | 2011 |-align="center" |Western Carolina |1 |align=left | 2020 |} ==See also== *Kay Yow Award – an annual award given to an NCAA Division I women's basketball coach who exhibits moral character both on and off the court; the award is also presented by CollegeInsider.com ==References== ;General * ;Specific ==External links== * Category:College basketball coaching awards in the United States Category:Awards established in 2008
title: Skip Prosser Man of the Year Award
